summary: Bur cucumber is a common name for several plants and may refer to:  Cucumis anguria, native to Africa and naturalized in many other parts of the world Echinocystis lobata, native to North America Sicyos Sicyos angulatus, native to eastern North America

flower.description: Monoecious, male flower length 10cm, diameter 1cm, hangs at the end of long peduncle, anthers are fused to form a lump. 1 cm in diameter and about 10 cm in length. Female flowers are 6mm in diameter, light green, with one pistil, forming a cap at the end of a short peduncle.
flower.color: Yellowish white (male flowers), pale green (female flowers)

shape.stem: vine nature. Climbs to wind other objects with tendrils split into 3 or 4, angular, densely pubescent.
shape.leaf: Round, 5-7 thousand rows, 8-12 cm in diameter, base, acute or apices. Petiole 3-12 cm long, densely hairy.
shape.fruit: Long oval shape, no stalk, 3-10 clustered, covered with thin thorns
